$interpreted: Dorm Student: Elio the traitor, you and your accomplices better sit tight until you're captured!
Dorm Student: Continue the attack, do not give up!
Aosta: Ugh...
Dorm Student: Excellent! He's almost unable to keep up with our attacks! Do not stop!
Aosta: In your dreams, chimp. You won't touch so much as a hair of the professor's.
Aosta: Damn it all...
Morris: ...Tsk, come help.
Aosta: Forgive me, Professor Dietrich...thank you.
Morris: Hmph.
Morris: ...I'll get to you later.
Morris: Take your leave. Balzac is one thing, but from what I've seen here, whatever I've missed these past 29 years is not even worth considering.
Dorm Student: Big words for a TRAITOR! Today I shall capture you...for the queen!
Morris: Well, you asked for it...
Barbara: Wait!
Dorm Student: Headmaster! You've come at the perfect time!
Dorm Student: ...Headmaster?
Morris: Hmph, I've waited all day for you. Better make the right choice.
Morris: As for our proposal, do you accept?
Barbara: ——You, do not touch these two.
Dorm Student: Headmaster!? There's a warrant out for his arrest in the Kingdom of the Sun...
Barbara: I know what you want to say, but they shall remain here. They will prove to be useful.
Barbara: As headmaster, I have made this decision after considering what is best for the Academy.
Barbara: Please leave immediately and do not tell anyone what you have seen.
Dorm Student: But——
Barbara: No "buts"! That's an order from the headmaster!
Barbara: Professor, if I need you as a sample for my research on Crystals, I'd appreciate your assistance.
Morris: Hmph. You've made the right decision. The search for knowledge requires taking risks from time to time.
Morris: You've passed the test, Balzac.
Aosta: ...What!?
Morris: What's the matter? You can't resist power as weak as this?
Morris: Your name has not appeared in the past few years of Rune research.
Morris: Unable to deal with those chimps back there, let alone Balzac's magic.
Aosta: I...
Morris: I have a 29-year gap in knowledge, and you——
Morris: You've been living all this, what's the variable in your equation!?
Morris: ANSWER ME!
Morris: ——Balzac!
Barbara: Ah, yes!
Morris: You're the current headmaster. Tell me...when did he become such a degenerate?
Barbara: Clovis...left the Academy 18 years ago. After that, he removed himself from academic circles.
Barbara: I heard he was serving as a doctor on Paradise Prairie, focusing on curing the strange disease known as Void Disease.
Aosta: ...That's correct.
Aosta: I gave up on my responsibilities to the School of Life Magic. I focused on healing void disease in order to get some ideas on how to resurrect you.
Aosta: In my later years at the Academy, I realized...
Morris: Realized what!?
Aosta: That to I, Aosta Clovis, there was nothing more important than bringing you back to life, Professor.
Morris: You——!
Aosta: ...Professor Dietrich?
Morris: Shut your mouth. I've nothing to say to you.
Morris: Leave me...you baboon.
Barbara: .........
Aosta: ...Understood.
